## Markdown

Markdown is an easy to read and write text format:

- It's _plain text_ so works well with version control
- It can be **rendered** into HTML, PDF, and more
- Learn more at: <https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/>

## Equation

Use LaTeX to write equations:

$$
\chi' = \sum_{i=1}^n k_i s_i^2 
$$
$$
f_m \to f \quad \text{in } C^{\infty}
$$

::: {#4ebc9b6b .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
sum = 0
n = 1000
for i in range(n):
    sum += i
print("Sum of first ", n, "integers is ", sum)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Sum of first  1000 integers is  499500
```
:::
:::


---

title: "Quarto Basics"
format:
  html:
    code-fold: true
jupyter: python3
---

For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see @fig-polar.

::: {#cell-fig-polar .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![A line plot on a polar axis](index_files/figure-html/fig-polar-output-1.png){#fig-polar width=450 height=439}
:::
:::
